verses.kjv: And Dinah the daughter of Leah, which she bare unto Jacob, went out to see the daughters of the land.
verses.ct: Dinah, the daughter that Leah had given to Jacob, went out to visit the young women of that region.

verses.kjv: And when Shechem the son of Hamor the Hivite, prince of the country, saw her, he took her, and lay with her, and defiled her.
verses.ct: When Shechem son of Hamor the Hivite, the ruler of that area, saw her, he grabbed her and had relations with her by force, violating her.

verses.kjv: And his soul clave unto Dinah the daughter of Jacob, and he loved the damsel, and spake kindly unto the damsel.
verses.ct: But then he became deeply attached to Dinah, Jacob's daughter. He fell in love with the young woman and spoke tenderly to her.

verses.kjv: And Shechem spake unto his father Hamor, saying, Get me this damsel to wife.
verses.ct: Shechem told his father Hamor, "Arrange for me to marry this young woman."

verses.kjv: And Jacob heard that he had defiled Dinah his daughter: now his sons were with his cattle in the field: and Jacob held his peace until they were come.
verses.ct: Jacob found out that Shechem had violated his daughter Dinah, but since his sons were out in the fields with the livestock, he kept quiet until they returned.

verses.kjv: And Hamor the father of Shechem went out unto Jacob to commune with him.
verses.ct: Meanwhile, Hamor, Shechem's father, went out to speak with Jacob.

verses.kjv: And the sons of Jacob came out of the field when they heard it: and the men were grieved, and they were very wroth, because he had wrought folly in Israel in lying with Jacob’s daughter; which thing ought not to be done.
verses.ct: When Jacob's sons came in from the fields and heard what had happened, they were devastated and furious, because Shechem had done something outrageous in Israel by having relations with Jacob's daughter — something that should never have been done.

verses.kjv: And Hamor communed with them, saying, The soul of my son Shechem longeth for your daughter: I pray you give her him to wife.
verses.ct: Hamor spoke with them and said, "My son Shechem has his heart set on your daughter. Please let him marry her.

verses.kjv: And make ye marriages with us, and give your daughters unto us, and take our daughters unto you.
verses.ct: Intermarry with us — give your daughters to us, and take our daughters for yourselves.

verses.kjv: And ye shall dwell with us: and the land shall be before you; dwell and trade ye therein, and get you possessions therein.
verses.ct: You can settle among us. The whole land is open to you — live here, do business, and acquire property."

verses.kjv: And Shechem said unto her father and unto her brethren, Let me find grace in your eyes, and what ye shall say unto me I will give.
verses.ct: Then Shechem himself said to Dinah's father and brothers, "Let me earn your approval. Whatever you ask of me, I'll pay it.

verses.kjv: Ask me never so much dowry and gift, and I will give according as ye shall say unto me: but give me the damsel to wife.
verses.ct: Set the bride price and the gift as high as you want, and I'll pay whatever you demand. Just let me marry the young woman."

verses.kjv: And the sons of Jacob answered Shechem and Hamor his father deceitfully, and said, because he had defiled Dinah their sister:
verses.ct: Jacob's sons responded to Shechem and his father Hamor with deception, because Shechem had violated their sister Dinah.

verses.kjv: And they said unto them, We cannot do this thing, to give our sister to one that is uncircumcised; for that were a reproach unto us:
verses.ct: They told them, "We can't possibly do this. Giving our sister to a man who isn't circumcised would be a disgrace to us.

verses.kjv: But in this will we consent unto you: If ye will be as we be, that every male of you be circumcised;
verses.ct: We'll agree to your proposal only on this condition: that every male among you gets circumcised, just as we are.

verses.kjv: Then will we give our daughters unto you, and we will take your daughters to us, and we will dwell with you, and we will become one people.
verses.ct: Then we'll give our daughters to you and take your daughters for ourselves, and we'll live among you and become one people.

verses.kjv: But if ye will not hearken unto us, to be circumcised; then will we take our daughter, and we will be gone.
verses.ct: But if you won't listen to us and get circumcised, then we'll take our sister and leave."

verses.kjv: And their words pleased Hamor, and Shechem Hamor’s son.
verses.ct: Their proposal seemed good to Hamor and his son Shechem.

verses.kjv: And the young man deferred not to do the thing, because he had delight in Jacob’s daughter: and he was more honourable than all the house of his father.
verses.ct: The young man didn't waste any time doing it, because he was so in love with Jacob's daughter. He was the most respected person in his father's entire household.

verses.kjv: And Hamor and Shechem his son came unto the gate of their city, and communed with the men of their city, saying,
verses.ct: So Hamor and his son Shechem went to the gate of their city and addressed the men of the town.

verses.kjv: These men are peaceable with us; therefore let them dwell in the land, and trade therein; for the land, behold, it is large enough for them; let us take their daughters to us for wives, and let us give them our daughters.
verses.ct: "These people are friendly toward us," they said. "Let them settle in our land and do business here — after all, the land is large enough for all of us. We can marry their daughters, and they can marry ours.

verses.kjv: Only herein will the men consent unto us for to dwell with us, to be one people, if every male among us be circumcised, as they are circumcised.
verses.ct: But the men will only agree to live among us and become one people on this one condition: every male among us must be circumcised, just as they are.

verses.kjv: Shall not their cattle and their substance and every beast of theirs be ours? only let us consent unto them, and they will dwell with us.
verses.ct: Think about it — won't their livestock, their property, and all their animals eventually become ours? Let's just agree to their terms, and they'll settle here with us."

verses.kjv: And unto Hamor and unto Shechem his son hearkened all that went out of the gate of his city; and every male was circumcised, all that went out of the gate of his city.
verses.ct: Everyone who gathered at the city gate listened to Hamor and Shechem, and every male in the city was circumcised.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass on the third day, when they were sore, that two of the sons of Jacob, Simeon and Levi, Dinah’s brethren, took each man his sword, and came upon the city boldly, and slew all the males.
verses.ct: On the 3rd day, while all the men were still in pain, 2 of Jacob's sons — Simeon and Levi, Dinah's full brothers — each took a sword, boldly entered the city, and killed every male.

verses.kjv: And they slew Hamor and Shechem his son with the edge of the sword, and took Dinah out of Shechem’s house, and went out.
verses.ct: They killed Hamor and his son Shechem with their swords, took Dinah from Shechem's house, and left.

verses.kjv: The sons of Jacob came upon the slain, and spoiled the city, because they had defiled their sister.
verses.ct: Then Jacob's other sons came upon the dead and looted the city, because the people had allowed their sister to be violated.

verses.kjv: They took their sheep, and their oxen, and their asses, and that which was in the city, and that which was in the field,
verses.ct: They seized their sheep, cattle, and donkeys — everything in the city and everything in the fields.

verses.kjv: And all their wealth, and all their little ones, and their wives took they captive, and spoiled even all that was in the house.
verses.ct: They carried off all their wealth, captured all their children and wives, and plundered everything inside the houses.

verses.kjv: And Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, Ye have troubled me to make me to stink among the inhabitants of the land, among the Canaanites and the Perizzites: and I being few in number, they shall gather themselves together against me, and slay me; and I shall be destroyed, I and my house.
verses.ct: Jacob said to Simeon and Levi, "You've brought disaster on me! You've made me despised by everyone living in this land — the Canaanites and the Perizzites. I have only a few men. If they unite against me and attack, my entire family will be wiped out."

verses.kjv: And they said, Should he deal with our sister as with an harlot?
verses.ct: But they replied, "Should we have let him treat our sister like a prostitute?"
